nodes.text: Constable's Caps was a dish consisting of gray fungus stuffed with various fillings. The dish's quirky name was inspired by the Kyuzo Outpost Militia of Niima Outpost on the planet Jakku, who were led by a constable and wore Kyuzo war shield helmets that bore a striking resemblance to the fungus caps used in the dish. At some point following the Battle of Takodana in 34 ABY, the Artiodac chef Strono Tuggs included a recipe for the dish in his cookbook, The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook.

In the book, Tuggs suggested that  the best place to find large fungus to use in the recipe was the fungal forests of the planet Skako Minor, and stated that a wide range of fillings could be used to stuff the fungus including diced meat, mixed vegetables or even imitation killcrab. Tuggs provided a recipe using his favorite filling, which included bread crumbs and cheese.

Constable's Caps was created as one of the recipes in the 2019 cookbook Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, which was written by Marc Sumerak and Chelsea Monroe-Cassel. The out-of-universe recipe uses button mushrooms cooked with butter and minced garlic, then stuffed and further baked with a mixture of panko breadcrumbs, grated Parmesan cheese, finely chopped green onions, chopped parsley, garam masala, salt, and pepper.
